trans-unit.source: Azure Service Definition Schema (.csdef File)
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Definition Schema (.csdef File)

trans-unit.source: The service definition file defines the service model for an application.
trans-unit.target: The service definition file defines the service model for an application.

trans-unit.source: The file contains the definitions for the roles that are available to a cloud service, specifies the service endpoints, and establishes configuration settings for the service.
trans-unit.target: The file contains the definitions for the roles that are available to a cloud service, specifies the service endpoints, and establishes configuration settings for the service.

trans-unit.source: Configuration setting values are set in the service configuration file, as described by the <link xlink:href="b1ae68cd-cc95-48cb-a4a4-da91dc708a35" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Configuration Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: Configuration setting values are set in the service configuration file, as described by the <link xlink:href="b1ae68cd-cc95-48cb-a4a4-da91dc708a35" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Configuration Schema</link>.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Azure Diagnostics configuration schema file is installed to the <codeInline>C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Windows Azure\.NET SDK\%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;\schemas</codeInline> directory.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Azure Diagnostics configuration schema file is installed to the <codeInline>C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Windows Azure\.NET SDK\%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;\schemas</codeInline> directory.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the installed version of the <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/downloads/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the installed version of the <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/downloads/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The default extension for the service definition file is .csdef.
trans-unit.target: The default extension for the service definition file is .csdef.

trans-unit.source: Basic service definition schema
trans-unit.target: Basic service definition schema

trans-unit.source: The service definition file must contain one <languageKeyword>ServiceDefinition</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The service definition file must contain one <languageKeyword>ServiceDefinition</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The service definition must contain at least one role (<languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>WorkerRole</languageKeyword>) element.
trans-unit.target: The service definition must contain at least one role (<languageKeyword>WebRole</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>WorkerRole</languageKeyword>) element.

trans-unit.source: It can contain up to 25 roles defined in a single definition and you can mix role types.
trans-unit.target: It can contain up to 25 roles defined in a single definition and you can mix role types.

trans-unit.source: The service definition also contains the optional <languageKeyword>NetworkTrafficRules</languageKeyword> element which restricts which roles can communicate to specified internal endpoints.
trans-unit.target: The service definition also contains the optional <languageKeyword>NetworkTrafficRules</languageKeyword> element which restricts which roles can communicate to specified internal endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The service definition also contains the optional <languageKeyword>LoadBalancerProbes</languageKeyword> element which contains customer defined health probes of endpoints.
trans-unit.target: The service definition also contains the optional <languageKeyword>LoadBalancerProbes</languageKeyword> element which contains customer defined health probes of endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The basic format of the service definition file is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The basic format of the service definition file is as follows.

trans-unit.source: Schema definitions
trans-unit.target: Schema definitions

trans-unit.source: The following topics describe the schema:
trans-unit.target: The following topics describe the schema:

trans-unit.source: ServiceDefinition Element
trans-unit.target: ServiceDefinition Element

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ServiceDefinition</languageKeyword> element is the top-level element of the service definition file.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ServiceDefinition</languageKeyword> element is the top-level element of the service definition file.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>ServiceDefinition</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>ServiceDefinition</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Attribute
trans-unit.target: Attribute

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: name
trans-unit.target: name

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the service.
trans-unit.target: The name of the service.

trans-unit.source: The name must be unique within the service account.
trans-unit.target: The name must be unique within the service account.

trans-unit.source: topologyChangeDiscovery
trans-unit.target: topologyChangeDiscovery

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of topology change notification.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of topology change notification.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Blast</languageKeyword> - Sends the update as soon as possible to all role instances.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Blast</languageKeyword> - Sends the update as soon as possible to all role instances.

trans-unit.source: If you choose option, the role should be able to handle the topology update without being restarted.
trans-unit.target: If you choose option, the role should be able to handle the topology update without being restarted.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>UpgradeDomainWalk</languageKeyword> – Sends the update to each role instance in a sequential manner after the previous instance has successfully accepted the update.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>UpgradeDomainWalk</languageKeyword> – Sends the update to each role instance in a sequential manner after the previous instance has successfully accepted the update.

trans-unit.source: schemaVersion
trans-unit.target: schemaVersion

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the service definition schema.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the service definition schema.

trans-unit.source: The schema version allows Visual Studio to select the correct SDK tools to use for schema validation if more than one version of the SDK is installed side-by-side.
trans-unit.target: The schema version allows Visual Studio to select the correct SDK tools to use for schema validation if more than one version of the SDK is installed side-by-side.

trans-unit.source: upgradeDomainCount
trans-unit.target: upgradeDomainCount

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of upgrade domains across which roles in this service are allocated.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of upgrade domains across which roles in this service are allocated.

trans-unit.source: Role instances are allocated to an upgrade domain when the service is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Role instances are allocated to an upgrade domain when the service is deployed.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>How to: Update a cloud service role or deployment</linkText><linkUri>https://www.windowsazure.com/manage/services/cloud-services/how-to-manage-a-cloud-service/#updaterole</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>How to: Update a cloud service role or deployment</linkText><linkUri>https://www.windowsazure.com/manage/services/cloud-services/how-to-manage-a-cloud-service/#updaterole</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can specify up to 20 upgrade domains.
trans-unit.target: You can specify up to 20 upgrade domains.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the default number of upgrade domains is 5.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the default number of upgrade domains is 5.
